definition: to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
hatred/animosity/enmity/foe/enemy/to feel animosity toward (the wealthy, foreigners etc)
spouse/companion
surname Qiu
to look at/to regard/to inspect

sentences.english: I neither complain for lacking money nor hostile to riches and honour.
sentences.chinese: 淡薄名利，寧靜致遠，既不抱怨貧賤又不仇視富貴。

sentences.english: Kitty was down on the junior typist.
sentences.chinese: 基蒂仇視那個年輕的打字員。

sentences.english: Sometimes, our love for Jesus causes some people to hate us.
sentences.chinese: 有時，因着我們對主耶穌的愛，會導致人們仇視我們。

sentences.english: Churned up dark undercurrents of ethnic and religious hostility.
sentences.chinese: 攪起種族和宗教仇視的邪惡潛流。

sentences.english: During his life, he is treated badly by everyone except Old Earnshaw and Catherine.
sentences.chinese: 除了老恩肖和凱瑟琳，所有的人都仇視他。

sentences.english: Do not take hostile point of view yo.
sentences.chinese: 不要帶着仇視的眼光來看喲。

sentences.english: The two families have been feuding for generations.
sentences.chinese: 那兩家族彼此仇視已歷數代。

sentences.english: Why so many peeps are jealous and hateful of China? Shouldn't we all be rejoicing! ? 2015-know what I mean?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼會有這麼多管中窺豹的人嫉妒和仇視中國？

sentences.english: Kill me with spites; yet we must not be fors.
sentences.chinese: 儘管毒殺我，我們可別相仇視。

sentences.english: When she began recovering her memories, she held no ill-will toward Boba.
sentences.chinese: 當辛塔絲開始恢復記憶時，她對波巴不再仇視。

sentences.english: China haters and bashers please take a day off.
sentences.chinese: 那些仇視和抨擊中國的人，請給你們自己放一天假吧。

sentences.english: The hatred of instruction for the children of the people was a dogma.
sentences.chinese: 仇視平民兒童的教養，原是一種信念。

sentences.english: The two groups hate each other, and a High-Heel will refuse to speak to a Low-Heel.
sentences.chinese: 兩個集團相互仇視，高跟派人會拒絕與低跟派人說話。

sentences.english: Nobody understands why there's bad blood between those two classmates.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人知道那兩個同學爲什麼互相仇視。

sentences.english: With both sides blaming each other for the animosity, it is often difficult to untangle the truth.
sentences.chinese: 雙方相互指責對方仇視自己，一時讓人不明真相。

definition: feudalism
unification and independence
to incite disharmony/to instigate
hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
rude and unreasonable
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
preconceived idea/bias/prejudice
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
twisted roots and intertwined joints (idiom); complicated and very tricky/knotty and deeply-rooted difficulties
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
militarism
